content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a function in Julia that should do what you're asking for:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    doc = parse_markdown(md)
    code_blocks = filter(x -> x isa CodeBlock && occursin("julia", x.meta), doc.blocks)
    code_string = join([strip(x.text) for x in code_blocks], "\n\n")
    return code_string
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown.jl` package to parse the input markdown string. It then filters out the code blocks that have a "julia" language identifier in their metadata. It removes any leading or trailing whitespace from the code text and joins all the code blocks together with two newlines between them. The result is returned as a string.
